title: Yoshihiro Natsuka
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. He played for the <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Natsuka was born in <a href="Funabashi%2C%20Chiba">Funabashi</a> on October 7, 1969. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="Shonan%20Bellmare">Fujita Industries</a> (later "Bellmare Hiratsuka") in 1988. In 1994, the club won <a href="1994%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1994 Emperor's Cup</a> and he was selected Best Eleven. In Asia, the club also won <a href="1995%20Asian%20Cup%20Winners%27%20Cup">1995 Asian Cup Winners' Cup</a>. However, he left the club end of 1998 season due to financial strain. In 1999, he moved to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club <a href="Hokkaido%20Consadole%20Sapporo">Consadole Sapporo</a>. The club won the champions in 2000 and was promoted to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a>. He retired in 2001.
National team career.
On May 22, 1994, Natsuka debuted for <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="Australia%20national%20soccer%20team">Australia</a>. In 1994, he played full time in all matches included <a href="Football%20at%20the%201994%20Asian%20Games">1994 Asian Games</a>. In 1995, he also played at <a href="1995%20King%20Fahd%20Cup">1995 King Fahd Cup</a>. He played 11 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 1995.
